qas.question: What is the annual construction industry revenue in 2014?
How many firms were existing in 2005?
The average contractor hired how many employees?
How many women were employed in construction in 2011?
What was the unemployment rate as of 2011?
According to 1 million contractors  what was the annual revenue in 2014?
In 2005 how many employees were employed by the government?
How many firms were there in 2011?
In the US how many contractors were employed in construction as of 2011?

context: In the United States, the industry in 2014 has around <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b6_0>$960 billion<b6_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> in annual revenue according to statistics tracked by the Census Bureau, of which <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>$680 billion<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> is private (split evenly between residential and nonresidential) and the remainder is government. As of 2005, there were about <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b8_0>667,000 firms<b8_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> employing 1 million contractors (200,000 general contractors, 38,000 heavy, and 432,000 specialty); the average contractor employed <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>fewer than 10<a3_2/><a3_1/> employees<b7_0/><a3_0/>. As a whole, the industry employed an estimated 5.8 million as of April 2013, with a <b5_0>13.2%<b5_0/> unemployment rate. In the United States, approximately <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>828,000<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_0/> women<a4_1/> were employed in the construction industry as of 2011.
